review.title: SF week end
review.reviewText: The location is not so great. This is very noisy, you could hear the wind blowing through the windows that left air going through. Windows need some remodeling. Otherwise the lobby of the hotel is nice.
review.negativeRemarks: remodeling the rooms please, and especially the windows. You can hear everything in the rooms next door
review.locationRemarks: Would not stay there again. When i booked, I did not know the area, but really when you are with a kid, you do not want to stay int his area.

review.title: For the price it was great
review.reviewText: Close to BART and Muni so getting around the city was easy. The hotel is in lower rent part of the city. So if you are choosing to stay here, make sure you are comfortable with homelessness, drug addiction and mental illness. It is part of the city experience.
Had a great stay. Clean, comfortable, and conveniently located. Checking in and checking out was fast and easy.
review.locationRemarks: Near the train system, which can take you all over town.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Close and convient to shops and food. Can walk and get cab quickly. Walls are very thin. You can hear your neighbor like they are in your room. Our room was very bright in the morning. The curtains didn't block out sun very well.
Good place and services. Good bar and restaurant. I can come back again in the future.

review.title: Nice Hotel Central to all the sights
review.reviewText:
It's hard to choose hotels in big cities that you're not familiar with; you never know what you're going to get. This Holiday Inn is one of the best I've stayed at, with newer facilities, a restaurant, bar, and convenient (albeit pricey) parking. $37 a night to park but that's expected in the big city.

The room was nice with a cool view of San Fran, right in the heart of the Civic Center area. This is pretty centrally located to anywhere you want to go, which was great for my girlfriend and I. The room came with a Keurig coffee (we had a King Bed room) and was very clean. Seemed like it had been renovated recently. Staff was very friendly, check-in was kind of a wait but what can you do? Plus, their vending machines for pop only cost $1.50. When is the last time that happened?

The walls are a bit thin, so if you're offended by late-night/early-morning love-making, maybe get some earplugs or check elsewhere. But it really wasn't bad and we had a really nice stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Central location, nice staff, newer rooms and convenient parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Balcony doors. You have these nice balconies off the rooms but none of the doors open! That would have been really nice. Improve check-in wait.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is central, but close to there is the Civic Center, Union Square and you're not too far from Mission Dist. and even Castro St.!

review.reviewText: It was a clean hotel, but there was no refrigerator. Cleaning staff bothered us more than once. And the beds were hard.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for reviewing our hotel and for all five stars!  We’re thrilled to know that our team took good care of you.  Each employee works very hard to provide outstanding service so it’s nice to hear about it when we succeed.  We look forward to welcoming you again the next time you visit San Francisco. 

Warm regards, Holiday Inn Civic Center

review.reviewText: The staff was awesome. They took great care of me. Above and beyond my expectations.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  We’re pleased to know that our location was convenient for your needs and that you slept well.  After all, we are in the sleep business!  We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you again when your travels next bring you to San Francisco.

Warm regards, Holiday Inn Civic Center

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Walking distance to Bill Grahm Civic Center. Room was clean, bed was a little too firm but I slept fine. Bathroom is standard, clean but no frills.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  We’re always looking to improve our guests’ experiences so your feedback is appreciated.  We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you again in the future.  

Warm regards, Holiday Inn Civic Center

review.title: Disappointed,in dirty area with many homeless
review.reviewText: No refrigerator or microwave in room.Roll away bed mattress was old and creaked. Restaurant had limited menu and above average prices.We didn't eat there at all for regular meals.The pool chair cushions were moldy.Had to complain about yelling and fighting next door 2 nights in a row and no one followed up with us.
review.positiveRemarks: Housekeeping was great!Hotel was clean and good sucerity.
review.negativeRemarks: Basic rooms need a refrigerator and microwave.
review.locationRemarks: Next to main bus lines.City hall was in walking distance

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and for all five stars!!  We are always looking for ways to improve the experiences of our guests so your feedback is appreciated.  We will be sure to pass your comments on to our Housekeeping team.  We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you again when you next visit San Francisco.

Warm regards, Holiday Inn Civic Center

review.title: ...except maid service coming in at 8:30 AM
review.reviewText:
Hotel was fine and th reception services were great. However, I left early in the morning to check out views of the Golden Gate Bridge. 

I did not like coming back to find that the cleaning crew was about to enter my room at only 8:30 AM! I think it's ridiculous to start checking in on guests so early in the morning UNLESS it's confirmed that they've checked out. Whether I was inside sleeping or not, it would've been disruptive to me to have the maids checking in on me. I thought that's what reception was for. 

It wasn't a big deal since I was already awake and they didn't actually enter (I arrived at my door right as they knocked), but that's my ONLY complaint.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel and for all five stars!  We’re thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay and that our location was convenient for your needs.  We look forward to welcoming you again when you next visit San Francisco.  

Warm regards, Holiday Inn Civic Center

review.title: Great hotel and location
review.reviewText: Always stay here on our trips to San Francisco. Great location.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and for all five stars!  We are pleased to now that you had a good stay and that our staff took really good care of you.  We are also glad that our location was convenient for your needs.  We look forward to welcoming you again when you next visit San Francisco.

Warm regards, Holiday Inn Civic Center

review.title: Nice hotel in downtown SF
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice and clean. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. The area the hotel is in is a little sketchy, but if you are there just to eat and sleep in a nice clean and comfortable place then i would choose this hotel. Its close to transportation like the bart and the AT&T ballpark as well as the mall downtown. We didn't spend too much time at the hotel but like i said its a nice place to rest. I would stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: I like that it was clean and the staff was nice

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel.  We’re pleased to know that our location was convenient for your needs.  Downtown SF parking rates may be higher than you anticipated. We offer a great value and are actually the lowest priced hotel parking in downtown SF for indoor, 24hr access.  We hope to welcome you again in the future.

Warm regards, Holiday Inn Civic Center

review.title: Good hotel close to the Orpheum Theater
review.reviewText: We chose the HGI because it was so close to the Orpheum theater.  We could walk to it and that was needed. The room was clean but didn't have a microwave or refrigerator.  Hotel staff overall was good but some of the staff in the restaurant not so much.
review.negativeRemarks: I know parking in the city is expensive but the charge for guests was ridiculous.  Our a/c / heater didn't work as good as it should have.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  We are always looking for ways to improve our guests’ experiences so your feedback is appreciated.  We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you again when your travels next bring you to San Francisco.

Regards, Holiday Inn Civic Center

review.title: Not what anyone expect
review.reviewText: This is not what anyone expect for Holiday Inn in a downtown of a major city. There's only one chair (desk chair) in the room, no extra chair to sit in, no refrigerator in the room but they renting it for $20/day, does not replenished used up toiletries, there's only one incandescent light fixture in the bathroom by the sink so it's partly dark inside, does not include breakfast for the very expensive daily rate they charged--not really worth the money you pay.
review.negativeRemarks: They definitely need to improve their service & amenities or lower their daily rate charges including fees and taxes.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  We are always looking for ways to improve our guests’ experiences so your feedback is appreciated.  We are glad to know that our location was convenient for your needs and hope to have the opportunity to welcome you again in the future.

Regards, Holiday Inn Civic Center

review.title: Not impressed at all.
review.reviewText: Overall my experience was one that will also be my last. The staff was ok and I think 98% of them that I saw were Asian and older. They only have 1 restaurant in the hotel and frankly it's terrible and overpriced and horrid hours so make sure you bring your own food. They charge for everything and anything including like almost 20 a day for parking and it'snot really that secure and very small spaces. If you have a truck than I wish you the best of luck getting in and out. The positive about this was its close to where I was supposed to be during my trip made my life easier. The sleeping conditions well bed was horrid and the sheets and stuff they put on there even worse. I ended up going out and buying my own to feel comfortable and eventually slept on the floor one night due to how rock hard the bed felt. I definitely felt I didn't receive the holiday Inn experience I normally do when staying at one of their properties.
review.positiveRemarks: The one thing I did like about this hotel is that it was close to where I needed to be for the weekend.
review.negativeRemarks: I think the breakfast could use a ton of work and felt more like a high school cafeteria buffet and for the cost I didn't feel it was worth it.
review.locationRemarks: In down town not a lot of shops around except small ones and no store for food so either bring your own or GL spending so much on food.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for reviewing out hotel.  We’re glad to hear that our location was convenient for your needs and that our team took good care of you.  We look forward to welcoming you again soon. 

Warm regards, Holiday Inn Civic Center

review.title: Older hotel, needs repairs
review.reviewText: Staff was extremely helpful just not in a great area but easy to access buses, trolleys, etc.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  We love that the Holiday Inn name brought you to us.  We’re thrilled to know that our team members took good care of you and provided excellent service.  We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you again when your travels next bring you to San Francisco.

Warm regards, Holiday Inn Civic Center

review.reviewText:
I had an unplanned one night stay in San Francisco. Chose the Holiday Inn because it was a reputable chain, close to transport. Arriving early evening the staff were welcoming and patiently dealt with an issue with my credit card's magnetic strip not reading. Staff also gave some great suggestions and advice about getting around and what to see in the short amount of time I had available. 
Rooms were simple but clean and well presented.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel.  We’re pleased to know that our location was convenient for your needs.  We are also glad to know that you found our staff to be friendly and the property to be clean and well maintained.  Each team member works very hard so it’s nice to hear about it when we succeed.  We look forward to welcoming you again when business and/or pleasure next brings you to San Francisco.

Warm regards, Holiday Inn Civic Center

review.title: Business trip
review.reviewText:
Upon entering hotel Doorman very pleasant, received a warm welcome from front desk staff, hotel very clean
met all accomendations
review.locationRemarks: 4 blocks from downtown, 3 blocks from Van ness Avenue where movie theater/restaurants are, very close to metro train, Bart train.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent visit at our hotel and please accept our sincerest apologies for the disappointment you experienced during your stay due to the room conditions.  Rest assured that these issues will be looked into. We value your comments and welcome the opportunity to serve you again.

Warm regards, Holiday Inn Civic Center

review.title: upgraded to their best -> total disappointmen
review.reviewText: was upgraded to their top floor and placed in a room for their premier customers. the room's trash was full, and the shower had red mold all over the grout. this place was filthy!
